events.name: An American — Thomas Davenport — is credited with building the first electric vehicle (EV) in 1835, and by 1900 EVs were so popular that New York had a fleet of electric taxis and electric cars representing one third of all vehicles on the road.

events.name: Although it has a straightforward process and a reasonably mature technology, the main drawbacks are its high cost and high environmental pollution.
